  • java.lang.Object
    • se.idsec.signservice.security.sign.impl.DefaultSignatureValidationResult

    public class DefaultSignatureValidationResult
extends Object
implements SignatureValidationResult
    Default implementation of the SignatureValidationResult interface.
    Author:
    Martin Lindström (martin@idsec.se), Stefan Santesson (stefan@idsec.se)

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<X509Certificate> getAdditionalCertificates()
      Gets the certificates that are above the signer certificate in the chain (if received in the signature).
      CertificateValidationResult getCertificateValidationResult()
      In case a successful certificate validation was performed, this method returns the result from this operation.
      Exception getException()
      If this status represents a non-successful result, this method may return an exception object describing the underlying validation error.
      X509Certificate getSignerCertificate()
      Gets the certificate that was used to sign the validated document.

      Gets the overall validation status.

      Gets a status message.

      Predicate that tells if this result object represents a successful validation.

      Assigns the certificates that are above the signer certificate in the chain (if received in the signature).
      void setCertificateValidationResult(CertificateValidationResult certificateValidationResult)
      Assigns the certificate validation result for the signer certificate.
      void setError(InternalSignatureValidationException validationException)
      Sets the error status based on the supplied InternalSignatureValidationException exception object.

      Sets the status and status message during errors.

      • getStatusMessage

        public String getStatusMessage()
        Gets a status message. To be used for logging purposes.

        For non-successful results a message is always returned.

        Specified by:
        getStatusMessage in interface SignatureValidationResult
        Returns:
        status message

      • getSignerCertificate

        public X509Certificate getSignerCertificate()
        Gets the certificate that was used to sign the validated document.

        May be null in the rare cases when the certificate is not included in the signature, and when no validation certificates were supplied to the validation process.

        Specified by:
        getSignerCertificate in interface SignatureValidationResult
        Returns:
        the signature certificate

        public List<X509Certificate> getAdditionalCertificates()
        Gets the certificates that are above the signer certificate in the chain (if received in the signature).

        a list of additional certificates
